subject: Testing GUIs - mouse clicks, list selections, and other user inputs
msgSnippet: Can someone give me some references to how JUnit can be used to test GUIs? All the examples I ve seen test class fields, computations, etc. How do I test
messageBody:
Can someone give me some references to how JUnit can be used to test
GUIs? All the examples I've seen test class fields, computations, etc.

How do I test things that depend on mouse clicks and screen visuals such
as:

When I click on the column header 'Last Name' do the rows in the table
sort in alphabetic order? And do the first names stay with the proper
last name?

When my combo box selects 'animals' does the panel next to it fill with a
list of animals?

In my text editor, does the button for bold text go down when the user
selects a piece of text in the editor that is bold?

In my drawing progam, when I select red does the active line turn red?
Does the next shape I draw come in red?

If there's a book or two on the subject that would be ideal. If not, how
about some web sites with tutorials.
